Reasoning: The paper discusses the characterization of threshold functions in various mathematical contexts, including Boolean or switching functions, neural networks, hypergraphs, coherent structures, Sperner families, clutters, secret sharing, and simple games or binary voting systems. This suggests that the paper could be relevant to several arXiv CS sub-categories, such as Discrete Mathematics (cs.DM), Computational Complexity (cs.CC), Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE), Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS), and Game Theory (cs.GT).
